text: Central Atlas Tamazight, also known as Central Morocco Tamazight also known as Central Morocco Tamazight, Middle Atlas Tamazight, Tamazight, Central Shilha, and, rarely, Braber is a Berber language. It is of the Afro-Asiatic language family. It is spoken by 3 to 5 million people in Central Morocco, and by smaller communities in France and elsewhere. It is an official language of Morocco. Central Atlas Tamazight is one of the four most-spoken Berber languages. The other ones are Kabyle, Shilha, and Riff. ==References== Category:Berber languages Category:Languages of Morocco
title: Central Atlas Tamazight
